question: What is the role of the dean in the interruption of studies?
answer: The dean grants permission to interrupt studies based on a student's application and sets the conditions for the interruption.
answer_generated: The dean may interrupt a student's studies to avert imminent harm, provided it did not originate from previous study requirements. The decision must be in writing, and the student can appeal. If the student disagrees, they must express this in writing within 10 days. The dean will grant a request to interrupt studies if it relates to a recognized period of parenthood. (Document 1)
context:
Document 1: The dean  may,  upon  their  own  motion,  interrupt  a 
student's  studies  if it is necessary  in order  to avert  an imminent  harm  to the student,  provided  it 
did not originate  in connection  with  the previous  fulfilment  of study  requirements.   In this case,  
the studies  will not be interrupted  provided  the student  expresses  their  disagreement  in writing  
within  10 days  of receiving  the written  notice  of the possible  interr uption  of the studies.   The 
dean’s  decision  to interrupt  the studies  must  be made  in writing  in accordance  with  Section  68 of 
the Act and the student  may  appeal  against  the decision.   The dean  will always  grant  the request  
to interrupt  the studies  if the relevant  period  affected  by the request  is part of a recognized  
period  of parenthood.  
 (4) The doctoral  student  is obliged  to show  up once  a year  for enrolment  in the next  study  unit on a 
defined  date.   The enrolment  is conditioned  on the submission  of a report  of activities  and its 
approval  by the supervisor,  the head  of the training  centre  and the chair  of ORO.   If the student  
fails to show  up on the defined  date  and does  not submit  an apology  in writing  within  five days  of 
the date,  it will be considered  as a failure to fulfil  the study  requirements  of the study  programme  
under  these  Rules  and the student's  studies  will be terminated  pursuant  to Section  56, Para  1 (b) 
of the Act and Article  34, Para  7 (b) hereof.
